name: ID Card
desc: Allows limited access to areas of the sub.

name: Shipwreck ID Card
desc: This ID card allows access to most of the wreck, provided the door isn't rusted shut.

name: Sky Alien Artifact
desc: Artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Thermal Alien Artifact
desc: Artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Faraday Alien Artifact
desc: Artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Nasonov Alien Artifact
desc: Artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Psychosis Alien Artifact
desc: Artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Alien Trinket
desc: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Alien Curio
desc: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Alien Ornament
desc: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.

name: Oxygenite Shard
desc: An alien mineral.

name: Sulphurite Shard
desc: An alien mineral.

name: Alien Pistol
desc: A handgun powered by alien power cells.

name: Ancient Weapon
desc: A weapon with powerful capabilities.

name: Alien Power Cell
desc: An alien power source.

name: Button
desc: Produces a signal that can be used to toggle the state of equipment and doors.

name: Switch
desc: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.

name: Lever
desc: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.

name: Metal Crate
desc: A vessel in which items may be stored.

name: Secure Metal Crate
desc: A secure vessel in which items may be stored.

name: Explosive Crate
desc: A vessel in which explosives may be stored.

name: Chemical Crate
desc: A vessel in which chemicals may be stored.

name: Medic Crate
desc: A box for medical items and ingredients.

name: Artifact Transport Case
desc: A case to ease the transportation of alien artifacts.

name: Sealed Supply Crate
desc: A box of various in-demand supplies. Fetches a high price at outposts.

name: Veteran's Cap
desc: A well-worn cap that has seen many ports.

name: Renegade's Hat
desc: Strikes fear into the hearts of the Coalition.

name: Veteran's Jacket
desc: A warm jacket to protect its wearer against the cold depths.

name: Renegade's Jacket
desc: Indicates who is in charge.

name: Health Scanner HUD
desc: A heads-up display that shows information about the vital signs and status of nearby humans.

name: Medic's Fatigues
desc: For frontline medics. Offers some protection against enemies.

name: Doctor's Uniform
desc: Makes you look like you might be useful in a medical emergency.

name: Hazmat Suit
desc: Has a protective lead shielding against radiation.

name: Baseball Cap
desc: Every self-respecting mechanic should have one.

name: Assistant Clothes
desc: Even the assistant needs clothing.

name: Watchman Clothes
desc: Makes you look like you might offer a mission to a passerby at any moment.

name: Commando's Fatigues
desc: I ain't got time to bleed.

name: Security Officer's Uniform
desc: Obey my authority!

name: Gunner's Uniform
desc: A standard issue gunner's uniform.

name: Body Armor
desc: While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.

name: Ballistic Helmet
desc: While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.

name: Gunner's Helmet
desc: A bit lighter than a regular ballistic helmet; designed not to get in the way when one is operating a periscope.

name: Riot Helmet
desc: Designed for crowd control but equally useful against alien invaders.

name: Handcuffs
desc: Useful for restraining problem players.

name: Clown Mask
desc: Praise the honkmother.

name: Clown Costume
desc: Praise the honkmother.

name: Mother's Countenance
desc: Nothing remains hidden under mother's gaze.

name: Mother's Providence
desc: Nothing can escape mother's warm embrace.

name: Clown Crate
desc: A crate large enough to fit a prankster inside.

name: Headset
desc: Allows remote communication among the crew.

name: Duffel Bag
desc: The traditional way of storing a deceased seafarer's belongings until they can be delivered to their next of kin (or stolen or sold).

name: Alien Blood
desc: Blood extracted from a Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.

name: Velonaceps Calyx Eggs
desc: Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as 'husk parasite'.

name: Calyx Extract
desc: The Velonaceps Calyx or 'husk parasite' likes to bind itself to calcium, regardless of whether it's inside human bones or neatly packed inside a syringe.

name: Swim Bladder
desc: Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline.

name: Adrenaline Gland
desc: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.

name: Crawler Mask
desc: Protects wearer's identity. Fun at certain parties.

name: Husk Stinger
desc: A makeshift stabbing tool.

name: Moloch Shell Fragment
desc: A sturdy piece of a moloch's shell.

name: Mudraptor Shell
desc: A protective shell of a mudraptor.

name: Moloch Bone
desc: Piece of a Moloch bone. Considered an expensive luxury item by colony dwellers; can be sold at a high price.

name: Alien Circuitry
desc: Advanced looking circuitry, typically found within the inorganic guardians of the alien ruins.

name: Diver's Remains
desc: The less easily digested remains of the poor soul that met their untimely demise.

name: Hammerhead Ribs
desc: The ribs and fleshy remains of a Hammerhead. Can fetch a decent price in colonies.

name: Endworm Shell Fragment
desc: A sturdy piece of an endworm's shell.

name: Watcher Shell Fragment
desc: A sturdy piece of a watcher's shell.

name: Diving Mask
desc: Small enough to carry around in case it's needed, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach.

name: Diving Suit
desc: An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust. Only offers adequate protection up to the depth of 4,000 meters - beyond this point, an Abyss or Combat suit is required.

name: Underwater Scooter
desc: A battery-powered underwater propulsion device.

name: Abyss Diving Suit
desc: A heavy suit designed for deep sea exploration. Protects against damage and high pressure all the way down to 10,000 meters, reduces oxygen usage, but at a cost of reduced movement speed.

name: Combat Diving Suit
desc: An agile, lightweight suit designed for combat. Offers some protection against damage and withstands pressure up to the depth of 6,000 meters.

name: Disposable Diving Suit
desc: A disposable diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust.

name: Battery Cell
desc: Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells.

name: Fulgurium Battery Cell
desc: A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium.

name: Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: Red Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: Blue Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: Orange Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: Green Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: Black Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: Brown Wire
desc: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.

name: FPGA Circuit
desc: Field-programmable gate array—a multipurpose circuit that can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices.

name: And Component
desc: Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other.

name: Equals Component
desc: Sends a signal when both inputs receive the same signal.

name: Greater Component
desc: Sends a signal if the value the signal_in1 input is larger than the signal_in2 input.

name: Adder Component
desc: Outputs the sum of the received signals.

name: Color Component
desc: Outputs a combined color signal for light control.

name: Subtract Component
desc: Outputs the subtracted value of the received signals.

name: Multiply Component
desc: Outputs the product of the received signals.

name: Divide Component
desc: Outputs the divided value of the received signals.

name: Exponentiation Component
desc: Outputs the input raised to a given power.

name: Or Component
desc: Sends a signal if either of the inputs receives a signal.

name: Xor Component
desc: Sends a signal if either of the inputs, but not both, receives a signal.

name: Not Component
desc: Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal.

name: Concatenation Component
desc: Joins the inputs together and outputs the joined value (for example, the inputs "mud" and "raptor" would output "mudraptor").

name: Sin Component
desc: Outputs the sine of the input.

name: Cos Component
desc: Outputs the cosine of the input.

name: Tan Component
desc: Outputs the tangent of the input.

name: Asin Component
desc: Outputs the angle whose sine is equal to the input.

name: Acos Component
desc: Outputs the angle whose cosine is equal to the input.

name: Atan Component
desc: Outputs the angle whose tangent is equal to the input. If the "signal_in_x" and "signal_in_y" connections are used, the input is interpreted as a vector and the angle calculated using Atan2.

name: Round Component
desc: Rounds a numerical input to the nearest integer value.

name: Ceil Component
desc: Outputs the smallest integer value that is bigger than or equal to the input.

name: Floor Component
desc: Outputs the greatest integer value that is less than or equal to the input.

name: Factorial Component
desc: Outputs the factorial of the input.

name: Abs Component
desc: Outputs the absolute value of the input.

name: Square Root Component
desc: Outputs the square root of the input.

name: Modulo Component
desc: Outputs the remainder when the input is divided by a specific number.

name: Relay Component
desc: When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs.

name: Delay Component
desc: Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time.

name: Memory Component
desc: Outputs a stored value that can be updated from other sources. Use the signal_in connection to set the stored value, and the signal_store input to toggle whether the received signals should be stored.

name: Light Component
desc: General purpose lighting. Requires no electrical input.

name: Oxygen Detector
desc: Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air.

name: Water Detector
desc: Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged.

name: Smoke Detector
desc: Sends out a signal when it senses smoke.

name: Motion Detector
desc: Sends out a signal when it detects movement.

name: Signal Check Component
desc: Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received.

name: RegEx Find Component
desc: Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern.

name: Oscillator Component
desc: Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal.

name: Wifi Component
desc: Allows remote communication between other wifi components that are using the same channel.

name: Emergency Siren
desc: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.

name: Alarm Buzzer
desc: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.

name: Terminal
desc: Outputs a user-submitted string.

name: Logbook
desc: A handheld device used for storing messages.

name: Gene Splicer
desc: A device used to splice alien genes into a human. Equip the splicer in the health interface and insert genetic materials in the splicer to activate the genes. Once spliced onto a living subject, genetic material cannot be removed without destroying it.

name: Unidentified Genetic Material
deconsTo: Genetic Material (Crawler),Genetic Material (Mudraptor),Genetic Material (Moloch),Genetic Material (Mantis),Genetic Material (Tiger Thresher),Genetic Material (Hammerhead),Genetic Material (Hammerhead Matriarch),Genetic Material (Spineling),Genetic Material (Husk),Genetic Material (Mollusc),Genetic Material (Skitter),Genetic Material (Hunter)

name: Genetic Material (Crawler)
desc: Increases swimming speed by 10-50%.

name: Genetic Material (Mudraptor)
desc: Causes the subject to grow a mudraptor-like beak.

name: Genetic Material (Moloch)
desc: Increases resistance to physical damage by 10-25%

name: Genetic Material (Tiger Thresher)
desc: Decreases the subject's oxygen consumption by 20-100%.

name: Genetic Material (Mantis)
desc: Increases movement speed on land by 10-25%.

name: Genetic Material (Hammerhead)
desc: Allows the subject to to do 20-100% more damage with melee weapons.

name: Genetic Material (Hammerhead Matriarch)
desc: Makes the subject's physical injuries heal at a rate of 6-45% per minute.

name: Genetic Material (Spineling)
desc: Causes the subject to grow spineling-like bony protrusions out of their back.

name: Genetic Material (Husk)
desc: Prevents husk infections from advancing to the point where the parasite takes control of the host.

name: Genetic Material (Mollusc)
desc: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain 2-10% vigor.

name: Genetic Material (Skitter)
desc: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain 2-10% hyperactivity.

name: Genetic Material (Hunter)
desc: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain a 75-150% boost to melee weapon damage.

name: Text Display
desc: A scrolling text display.

name: Carbon
desc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic.

name: Iron
desc: Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon.

name: Tin
desc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components.

name: Lead
desc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition.

name: Phosphorus
desc: Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds.

name: Copper
desc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring.

name: Zinc
desc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid.

name: Sodium
desc: Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine. Reacts violently when coming into contact with water.

name: Silicon
desc: Used as an ingredient in aluminum alloys, plastic and various electrical components.

name: Calcium
desc: A silvery-white powder. Used to fabricate Tonic Liquid.

name: Aluminum
desc: A soft, lightweight metal. Used in the manufacture of diving equipment and some military applications.

name: Uranium
desc: Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.

name: Potassium
desc: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.

name: Titanium
desc: A hard and strong metal. Used for creating the durable Titanium-Aluminium alloy, as well as military applications.

name: Magnesium
desc: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds.

name: Lithium
desc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs. Reacts violently when in contact with water.

name: Chlorine
desc: Most commonly used in saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative.

name: Thorium
desc: A weakly radioactive, silvery metal. Can be refined to create longer lasting fuel rods.

name: Steel Bar
desc: A strong metal alloy of iron and carbon. Used in fuel rod manufacturing, as well as many military applications.

name: Titanium-Aluminum Alloy
desc: A very tough metal alloy. Used in durable diving gear and advanced weaponry.

name: Plastic
desc: An easily shaped, synthetic material. Contains Silicon and Carbon. Used in circuitry and various equipment.

name: Ballistic Fiber
desc: Strong fiber strung from plastic and titanium. Used in the manufacture of armor.

name: Organic Fiber
desc: Fiber created from plants. Used in the manufacture of clothing and bandages.

name: Rubber
desc: A tough and elastic substance. Used in the manufacture of diving gear and other equipment.

name: Flash Powder
desc: A quick burning powder, composed of magnesium and potassium. Used in flares and explosives.

name: Scrap
desc: A pile of possibly useful material.

name: Incendium Crystal
desc: A rare alien crystal capable of emitting extreme amounts of heat. Used in incendiary weapons.

name: Fulgurium Chunk
desc: A rare metallic alien material, capable of storing massive amounts of energy. Used in high capacity batteries.

name: Physicorium Bar
desc: An incredibly hard and durable alien material. Used in highly advanced weaponry and ammunition.

name: Dementonite Cluster
desc: A strange living metal. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.

name: Fiber Plant
desc: This plant has the texture of a coconut and its fibers move on their own under your fingers unnervingly. Can be processed into organic fiber.

name: Elastin Plant
desc: The foliage of this plant cannot be torn, only stretched. Can be processed into elastin.

name: Aquatic Poppy
desc: It's warm to the touch. Can be processed into opium.

name: Sea Yeast Shroom
desc: The smell is beyond belief, like rotting meat on a hot day. Can be processed into ethanol.

name: Slime Bacteria
desc: A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics.

name: Paralyxis
desc: A strange substance that numbs when touched. Used to create a powerful paralyzing agent.

name: Titanite
desc: A mineral containing titanium and iron.

name: Brockite
desc: A mineral containing thorium and phosphorus.

name: Thorianite
desc: A rare mineral containing thorium.

name: Amblygonite
desc: A mineral composed of lithium, aluminum and sodium.

name: Sphalerite
desc: A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form.

name: Pyromorphite
desc: A mineral composed of chlorine.

name: Quartz
desc: A crystalline mineral composed of silicon.

name: Diamond
desc: A crystal composed of solid carbon.

name: Hydroxyapatite
desc: A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus.

name: Uranium Ore
desc: A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium.

name: Ilmenite
desc: A mineral containing titanium.

name: Stannite
desc: A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin.

name: Chalcopyrite
desc: A mineral containing copper.

name: Esperite
desc: A mineral composed of zinc and lead.

name: Galena
desc: A mineral mostly consisting of lead.

name: Triphylite
desc: A mineral containing lithium.

name: Langbeinite
desc: A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium.

name: Chamosite
desc: A mineral consisting of iron and aluminum.

name: Iron Ore
desc: A mineral containing large amounts of iron.

name: Polyhalite
desc: A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium.

name: Graphite
desc: Carbon in crystalline form.

name: Sylvite
desc: A mineral containing potassium and sodium.

name: Lazulite
desc: A mineral containing phosphorus and iron.

name: Bornite
desc: A mineral containing copper.

name: Cassiterite
desc: A mineral consisting of tin.

name: Cryolite
desc: A mineral containing sodium.

name: Aragonite
desc: A mineral containing calcium.

name: Chrysoprase
desc: A mineral containing silicon.

name: Bandage
desc: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.

name: Plastiseal
desc: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.

name: Antibiotic Glue
desc: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.

name: Morphine
desc: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.

name: Fentanyl
desc: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.

name: Pomegrenade Extract
desc: Concentrated pomegrenade juice. It offers minor healing properties.

name: Saline
desc: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.

name: Blood Pack
desc: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.

name: Deusizine
desc: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and, to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.

name: Liquid Oxygenite
desc: A mildly toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.

name: Calyxanide
desc: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.

name: Haloperidol
desc: A strong antipsychotic drug.

name: Naloxone
desc: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate-based withdrawal and overdose.

name: Morbusine Antidote
desc: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.

name: Cyanide Antidote
desc: An antidote for acute cyanide poisoning.

name: Sufforin Antidote
desc: An antidote for acute sufforin poisoning.

name: Deliriumine Antidote
desc: An antidote for acute deliriumine poisoning.

name: Antirad
desc: Slows down cellular degradation caused by radiation.

name: Anaparalyzant
desc: A cure for paralysis. Beware: Excessive use may cause psychosis.

name: Elastin
desc: A highly elastic, naturally occurring protein. Can be used to stem bleeding or heal burns once processed to medical items.

name: Opium
desc: A relatively mild opioid obtained from aquatic poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.

name: Broad-spectrum Antibiotics
desc: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with the side effect of minor organ damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.

name: Stabilozine
desc: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be used to slow down the effects of most toxins.

name: Adrenaline
desc: A naturally occurring hormone. Used to manufacture medicine or combat stimulants.

name: Tonic Liquid
desc: A medical solution that's mildly effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.

name: Morbusine
desc: A highly potent neurotoxin, which causes an eventual shutdown of lungs and muscles, greatly hindering movement.

name: Chloral Hydrate
desc: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.

name: Cyanide
desc: A highly toxic chemical, which causes a rapid death once a sufficiently large dose has been administered.

name: Radiotoxin
desc: A highly radioactive substance, which causes radiation sickness and eventual liquification of inner organs.

name: Sufforin
desc: A stealthy neurotoxin, undetectable in early stages. Causes a loss of vision and in the end, death.

name: Deliriumine
desc: A psychosis-inducing toxin.

name: Paralyzant
desc: Causes paralysis.

name: Raptor Bane Extract
desc: Concentrated raptorbane juice. Mildly toxic for humans, catastrophically toxic for mudraptors.

name: Hallucinogenic Bufotoxin
desc: Hallucinogenic toxin secreted by some Europan species. Serves as an antiparalysant in a pinch.

name: Sulphuric Acid
desc: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.

name: Methamphetamine
desc: A potent nervous system stimulant.

name: Anabolic Steroids
desc: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.

name: Hyperzine
desc: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.

name: Ethanol
desc: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.

name: Guitar
desc: An old acoustic guitar.

name: Harmonica
desc: An old handmade harmonica.

name: Accordion
desc: An old handmade accordion.

name: Captain's Pipe
desc: For calming the nerves when the sea is stormy.

name: Pipe Tobacco
desc: Put it in your pipe and smoke it.

name: Bike Horn
desc: HONK!

name: Toolbelt
desc: A wearable container for storing tools and supplies.

name: Storage Container
desc: A portable container for storing tools and supplies.

name: Welding Tool
desc: One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater.

name: Plasma Cutter
desc: Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen.

name: Welding Fuel Tank
desc: Fuel for the welding tool.

name: Fire Extinguisher
desc: A handheld carbon dioxide extinguisher.

name: Sprayer
desc: Cleans or paints walls by spraying liquid on them.

name: Screwdriver
desc: Makes electrical repairs and rewiring possible.

name: Wrench
desc: Makes mechanical repairs possible.

name: Crowbar
desc: Forces doors and hatches open. Also a blunt weapon.

name: Handheld Sonar
desc: Portable sonar, handy for exploration.

name: Sonar Beacon
desc: Produces a localized signal that can be detected by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal.

name: Flashlight
desc: Handheld light.

name: Flare
desc: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.

name: Alien Flare
desc: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Burns for longer than a regular flare.

name: Flamer
desc: An incendiary weapon that fires a stream of burning welding fuel.

name: Syringe Gun
desc: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons.

name: Oxygen Tank
desc: Portable oxygen container.

name: Oxygenite Tank
desc: A tank containing liquid Oxygenite.

name: Fuel Rod
desc: A bar of enriched uranium, for use within a reactor.

name: Fulgurium Fuel Rod
desc: A bar of enriched fulgurium, for use within a reactor. Generates significantly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
recipes: Fulgurium Chunk,Lead,Steel Bar;Fulgurium Chunk,Fulgurium Fuel Rod

name: Thorium Fuel Rod
desc: A thorium bar, for use within a reactor. Generates slightly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.

name: Prototype Steam Cannon
desc: Gets rid of pests like nothing else. Patent pending.

name: Glowstick
desc: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.

name: Coilgun Ammunition Box
desc: Ammunition for the coilgun.

name: Physicorium Ammunition Box
desc: Coilgun ammunition made of alien material.
recipes: Physicorium Bar,Lead,Steel Bar,Aluminum;Physicorium Bar,Lead,Steel Bar,Physicorium Ammunition Box

name: Exploding Ammunition Box
desc: Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact.
recipes: C-4 Block,Steel Bar,Aluminum;C-4 Block,Steel Bar,Exploding Ammunition Box

name: Piercing Ammunition Box
desc: Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities.
recipes: Titanium-Aluminum Alloy,Steel Bar,Aluminum;Titanium-Aluminum Alloy,Steel Bar,Piercing Ammunition Box

name: Chaingun Ammunition Box
desc: A heavy box of ammo for the Chaingun.

name: Physicorium Chaingun Ammunition Box
desc: A backbreakingly heavy box of ammunition for the chaingun, utilizing Physicorium as its main material. These rounds have enough stopping power to occasionally stun any foe they hit.
recipes: Physicorium Bar,Titanium,Aluminum;Physicorium Bar,Titanium,Physicorium Chaingun Ammunition Box

name: Shredder Chaingun Ammunition Box
desc: A heavy box of ammunition for the chaingun. Designed to shred through flesh and armor of any enemy.
recipes: Lead,Titanium-Aluminum Alloy,Aluminum;Lead,Titanium-Aluminum Alloy,Shredder Chaingun Ammunition Box

name: Depth Charge Shell
desc: A barrel of explosives. Will sink and then explode.

name: Nuclear Depth Charge
desc: A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode.

name: Depth Decoy Shell
desc: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.

name: Nuclear Depth Decoy
desc: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.

name: UEX
desc: A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus.

name: C-4 Block
desc: A stable explosive compound.

name: Compound N
desc: A stable explosive compound.

name: Volatile Compound N
desc: An unstable explosive compound.

name: IC-4 Block
desc: A compound made of C-4 and incendium.

name: Detonator
desc: A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal.

name: Nitroglycerin
desc: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.

name: Spreader Flak Shells Box
desc: A heavy box of wide-spread shrapnel ammo for the flak cannon. Good against swarms.
recipes: Phosphorus,Steel Bar,Aluminum;Phosphorus,Steel Bar,Spreader Flak Shells Box

name: Focused Flak Shells Box
desc: A heavy box of low spread ammo for the flak cannon. Good against single targets.

name: Physicorium Flak Shells Box
desc: A backbreakingly heavy box of ammo for the flak cannon, utilizing Physicorium as its main material.
recipes: Physicorium Bar,Phosphorus,Aluminum;Physicorium Bar,Phosphorus,Physicorium Flak Shells Box

name: Explosive Flak Shells Box
desc: A heavy box of ammo for the flak cannon, loaded with high explosive materials.
recipes: C-4 Block,Steel Bar,Aluminum;C-4 Block,Steel Bar,Explosive Flak Shells Box

name: Pulse Laser Fuel Box
desc: A box of arranged chemicals and a focusing lens, useful for inducing intense bursts of energy. Used as ammo by the Pulse Laser.
recipes: Lithium,Alien Blood,Aluminum;Lithium,Alien Blood,Pulse Laser Fuel Box

name: Pulse Tri-Laser Fuel Box
desc: A box of containing a special concoction of chemicals and rare materials. The lens used splits the laser in three, allowing the laser to hit multiple targets at once.
recipes: Fulgurium Chunk,Alien Blood,Aluminum;Fulgurium Chunk,Alien Blood,Pulse Tri-Laser Fuel Box

name: Railgun Shell
desc: For firing from a railgun.

name: Nuclear Shell
desc: A nuclear shell for use with a railgun.

name: Physicorium Shell
desc: For firing from a railgun.

name: Canister Shell
desc: A reloadable burst-type munition for the railgun.

name: Harpoon
desc: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.

name: Physicorium Harpoon
desc: A harpoon for the harpoon gun, made of alien material.

name: Explosive Harpoon
desc: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.

name: Harpoon Gun
desc: Launches harpoons, explosive harpoons, and alien harpoons.

name: Revolver Round
desc: .38 caliber. Might stop a person...

name: Revolver
desc: .38 caliber.

name: SMG Magazine
desc: A magazine for .45 caliber SMG rounds.

name: SMG
desc: A .45 caliber submachine gun.

name: Stun Grenade
desc: Produces bright light and a loud sound on detonation, which stuns nearby characters.

name: EMP Grenade
desc: Damages electrical equipment.

name: Frag Grenade
desc: General purpose fragmentation grenade. Use carefully.

name: Incendium Grenade
desc: Incendiary grenade. Use very carefully.

name: Stun Baton
desc: If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a stun baton may be enough to beat an unruly crew member into submission.

name: Diving Knife
desc: Stabs, pokes, cuts and slashes.

name: Grenade Launcher
desc: A portable grenade launcher for 40mm grenades.

name: 40mm Grenade
desc: Ammunition for grenade launcher.

name: 40mm Stun Grenade
desc: Ammunition for grenade launcher. Non-lethal.

name: Riot Shotgun
desc: A shotgun designed for crowd control.

name: Shotgun Shell
desc: Ammunition for a shotgun. Lethal.

name: Shotgun Rubber Shell
desc: Ammunition for a shotgun. Less lethal.

name: Stun Gun
desc: A device for firing electrified darts.

name: Stun Gun Dart
desc: Causes electric shock to incapacitate a target. Non-lethal.

name: Toy Hammer
desc: Non-lethal but extremely annoying.

name: Boom Stick
desc: Barrels of fun.

name: Ahab's Spear
desc: An antique spear named after a legendary captain.

name: Europan Handshake
desc: For friends and enemies alike. Mostly enemies.

name: Deadeye Carbine
desc: A tactical weapon, available in black and slightly darker black.

name: Rifle
desc: A .30 caliber rifle with a manual reload mechanism. Slow rate of fire for unskilled users.

name: Rifle Bullet
desc: A .30 rifle bullet.

name: HMG
desc: Heavy Machine Gun, capable of dealing a lot of damage, provided the user is skilled enough to handle the recoil.

name: HMG Magazine
desc: A magazine of 5.56mm rounds for the HMG

name: Harpoon Coil-Rifle
desc: An advanced harpoon gun, powered by an energy source to launch harpoons at high velocities.

name: Machine Pistol
desc: A high rate of fire automatic weapon, using .45 (SMG) caliber magazines. Hard to aim.

name: Poop
desc: A pile of poop.

name: Pet Food
desc: The best food for your slimy friend.

name: Pet Name Tag
desc: Allows the naming of pets.

name: Mucus Ball
desc: A sticky ball of mucus.

name: Chitin Chunk
desc: A tough piece of chitin.

name: Chitin Helmet
desc: A tough helmet made of chitin.

name: Small Planter Box
desc: Suitable for most Europan plantlife while small enough to be transported around by hand.

name: Watering Can
desc: Keeps your plants happy and alive.

name: Fertilizer
desc: Carefully tended Europan soil guaranteed to give your plant the best living conditions.

name: Seed Bag
desc: Can store a wide variety of seeds.

name: Pomegrenade
desc: A tasty fruit. Its processed juice has minor healing properties.

name: Tobacco Bud
desc: Damp and strongly fragrant. Can be refined into serviceable pipe tobacco.

name: Mutated Raptor Bane
desc: It looks delicious, but should not be ingested under any circumstances. Not good for mudraptors.

name: Salt Bulb
desc: Salty. Avoid moisture.

name: Raptor Bane
desc: It looks delicious, but should not be ingested under any circumstances. Not good for mudraptors.

name: Mutated Pomegrenade
desc: A tasty fruit. Its processed juice has minor healing properties.

name: Pirate Costume
desc: A rugged outfit hand-crafted by the pirates, designed to endure the harsh conditions of seabound life on Europa. This specific outfit has been improved with light armor plating.

name: Pirate Body Armor
desc: A set of body armor, partially fashioned out of improvised materials by the pirates. It's heavier than it looks.

name: Pirate Helmet
desc: A pirate-customized ballistic helmet. Despite the crude improvements made to it, the helmet seems surprisingly sturdy.

name: The Sailor's Guide
desc: A small handbook that covers all the tasks associated with underwater sailing, though in limited scope.

name: Clown Diving Mask
desc: A clown mask combined with a diving mask, allowing the user to both clown around and breathe underwater.

name: Handheld Itemfinder
desc: A small handheld device with a screen, capable of easily finding items within the submarine.

name: Makeshift Shelves
desc: Crate storage shelves that can be manually installed on a submarine.

name: Ceremonial Sword
desc: A sharp sword to commemorate graduating. It takes varied skills to use it to it's highest potential.

name: Petraptor egg
desc: A slimy, pulsating mudraptor egg. Hard to believe that this one is friendly. Drop it on the floor and feed it with saline, maybe?

name: Handheld Status Monitor
desc: A small handheld device with a screen displaying the current status of the ship, informing the user of any breaches remotely.

name: Repair Pack
desc: A handheld contraption, capable of quickly correcting mechanical and electrical problems. Consumed on use.

name: Portable Pump
desc: A small battery-powered pump that can be installed on walls. Pumps out water very fast, but consumes a lot of power.

name: Safety Harness
desc: A special harness made to reduce workplace related injuries incurred on Europan submarines. The harness also dampens the effects of rushing water, stabilizing the user in the event of a hull breach.

name: Dementonite Wrench
desc: Fabricated from the poorly understood alien material dementonite. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.

name: Dementonite Crowbar
desc: Fabricated from the poorly understood alien material dementonite. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.

name: Dementonite Screwdriver
desc: Fabricated from the poorly understood alien material dementonite. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.

name: Dementonite Diving Knife
desc: Fabricated from the poorly understood alien material dementonite. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.

name: Fixfoam Grenade
desc: Emits a cloud of chemical sealant that quickly seals off leaks.

name: Heavy Wrench
desc: A large and heavy titanium wrench. Can only be properly swung by very burly mechanics.

name: Makeshift Armor
desc: A bulky and unwieldy set of iron plates, fashioned into something that resembles armor.

name: Iron Helmet
desc: A very simple and very heavy helmet that covers the entire face.

name: Exosuit
desc: A heavy battery-powered suit originally designed for underwater construction work. Heavily armored and capable of carrying heavy loads.

name: Scrap Cannon
desc: A battery-powered makeshift weapon that fires metal shrapnels. Wildly inaccurate, but not too picky when it comes to ammo – any piece of unprocessed iron or steel will do.

name: Defense Bot
desc: Build a deadly machine to look after you.

name: Defense Bot Ammunition Rounds
desc: Ammunition rounds for Defense Bot

name: Autoshotgun
desc: A roughly engineered automatic shotgun with a vast ammo capacity. Its size and heft makes it a bit cumbersome to lug around.

name: Assault Rifle
desc: An assault rifle chambering 6.8mm cartridges. Though banned by the Coalition, the schematics for these rifles are still passed around Europa as they present a premier option for submarine defense, or as the Separatists would prefer, societal revolution.

name: Assault Rifle Magazine
desc: A magazine designed for holding 6.8mm cartridges.

name: Explosive Slug
desc: A shotgun slug containing explosive material. Powerful, but still somewhat inaccurate on account of being fired out of a shotgun.

name: Bandolier
desc: A light combat rig, capable of carrying ammunition and other useful items. Thanks to improved ergonomics, increases combat effectiveness with ranged weapons and turrets.

name: Boarding Axe
desc: A hand axe, meant to be wielded with both hands.

name: Art of Submarine Warfare
desc: A small handbook with useful information pertaining to all things submarine warfare, with detailed pictures of elaborate tactical manuevers and proper firearms discipline.

name: Slipsuit
desc: A modified Combat Diving Suit with additional diving fins that aid the user when moving in water. Sadly, the fins also make it difficult to walk on solid ground.

name: Fulgurium Stun Gun Dart
desc: A highly potent stun gun dart that will drop any would-be creep like a sack of potatoes.

name: Riot Shield
desc: Blocks projectiles and prevents creatures or people from passing.

name: Depleted Fuel
desc: A heavy, hard material derived from processing a spent fuel rod. Can be further fabricated into tools and munitions.
recipes: Fuel Rod,Steel Bar;Thorium Fuel Rod,Steel Bar;Fulgurium Fuel Rod,Steel Bar;Volatile Fulgurium Fuel Rod,Steel Bar

name: Depleted Fuel Coilgun Ammunition Box
desc: A heavy box of depleted fuel ammunition for the coilgun. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
recipes: Depleted Fuel,Steel Bar,Aluminum;Depleted Fuel,Steel Bar,Depleted Fuel Coilgun Ammunition Box

name: Hardened Wrench
desc: A wrench that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for more efficient repairs and heavier swings.

name: Hardened Crowbar
desc: A crowbar that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material makes it easier to pry open doors and bash open heads.

name: Hardened Screwdriver
desc: A screwdriver that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for more efficient repairs and heavier swings.

name: Hardened Diving Knife
desc: A diving knife that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for deeper slashes and stabs.

name: Depleted Fuel Revolver Round
desc: A .38 round for the revolver, fashioned out of depleted fuel. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.

name: Depleted Fuel SMG Magazine
desc: A .45 caliber magazine for the SMG, containing rounds of depleted fuel ammo. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
recipes: Magnesium,Depleted Fuel,Steel Bar;Magnesium,Depleted Fuel,Depleted Fuel SMG Magazine

name: Thermal Goggles
desc: A thermal imaging device that makes it easier to distinguish living targets in poor lighting conditions, even through solid obstacles.

name: Reactor PDA
desc: A handheld device that can be used to remotely control the submarine's reactor.

name: The Handy Seaman
desc: A small handbook containing detailed information on the most-often-encountered technical problems on board the submarines of Europa, with simple-to-understand instructions for dealing with them.

name: Rapid Fissile Accelerator
desc: A prototype energy weapon built using the unique alien materials on Europa. The weapon induces a type of fission reaction at the end of the barrel, and releases it in a powerful beam once it is too violent to contain.

name: Cargo Scooter
desc: An underwater scooter special-made to transport material underwater. While the scooter is too large to be stored in one's inventory, its inherent buoyancy means the scooter will stay where you leave it.

name: Dirty Bomb
desc: An explosive compound mixed with highly radioactive material. Though the explosive payload is low, the ensuing fallout will catastrophically irradiate the area.

name: Handheld Electrical Monitor
desc: A small handheld device that gives the user remote access to information regarding the ship's electrical systems.

name: PUCS
desc: The Protective Universal Crisis Suit, or PUCS for short, bestows its user with immense resistances to environmental hazards such as radiation and fire. The built-in air-filtration system allows the suit to utilize hull oxygen when possible, and the built-in computer injects the user with whatever medicine is placed inside the suit.

name: Volatile Fulgurium Fuel Rod
desc: A Fulgurium fuel rod that has been further refined to supply power for much longer than normal. However, its radiation shielding can only partially limit the emitted ambient radiation, so the rod must be handled with care.
recipes: Steel Bar,Lead,Fulgurium Chunk,Thorium;Fulgurium Chunk,Thorium,Volatile Fulgurium Fuel Rod

name: Arc Emitter
desc: A handheld weapon based on electric discharge coil technology. Fires a high-voltage electrical arc.

name: Auto-Injector Headset
desc: A modifed headset utilizing an integrated battery, capable of injecting medicine placed within once the user's vitals drop to a certain level.

name: Europan Medicine
desc: A small handbook seeking to educate its reader on the proper conduct with treating the wounded and the sick using limited medical resources. The word "triage" appears to be mentioned a lot.

name: Combat Stimulant
desc: A highly advanced stimulant that makes the user rapidly recover from physical injuries and bloodloss.

name: Pressure Stabilizer
desc: A special drug that gives the user an immunity to pressure and removes their need for oxygen for a short duration.

name: Endocrine Booster
desc: This medical contraption, when used, bestows the user with permanent performance enhancement.

name: Advanced Gene Splicer
desc: A more advanced form of the gene splicer, capable of activating two types of genetic materials at the same time.

name: Advanced Syringe Gun
desc: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons. Has a higher capacity and integrated health scanner.

name: Europabrew
desc: A reagent that drastically increases the effect of acid burns.

name: Sulphuric Acid Syringe
desc: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Contained in a syringe.

name: Acid Grenade
desc: A grenade filled with acid, causing acid burns when it explodes.

name: 40mm Acid Grenade
desc: Ammunition for grenade launcher. Filled with acid, causing acid burns when it explodes.

name: Handcannon Round
desc: An exceedingly large .61 revolver round. The unique alloy of materials allows for high penetration and stopping power.

name: Handcannon
desc: A humongous beast of a revolver, designed to better deal with the large alien threats on Europa than typical firearms.

name: Commendation
desc: A small medal fashioned out of copper, originally created by the Coalition. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with a sum of experience.

name: Medal
desc: A small medal fashioned out of bronze, originally created by the Coalition. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with a large sum of experience.

name: Cigar
desc: A submariner's life is mentally taxing, but perhaps this exquisitely crafted cigar can help you soothe your nerves a bit.

name: Rum
desc: A fine liquor made from raptor bane juice. Some purists insist real rum is made from sugarcane — good luck finding any of that on Europa.
